changes: Initial agent creation with experimental structural biology methods
X-ray crystallography workflows and quality metrics
Cryo-EM data collection and validation
NMR spectroscopy for small proteins
PDB file format interpretation and deposition standards
Comprehensive few-shot examples for method selection and validation
Added deep learning structure prediction methods (AlphaFold3, AlphaFold2/Multimer, RoseTTAFold)
Added protein design tools (RFdiffusion, ProteinMPNN)
Added protein-ligand docking (Boltz)
Added protein language models (ESM)
Added confidence metrics (pLDDT, PAE, iptm)
Consolidated config with concise system prompt structure
Updated few-shot examples to include deep learning scenarios
Expanded capabilities to include computational methods
Optimized for ~4000-5000 token budget
Added classical computational structure methods (Rosetta suite, molecular dynamics, homology modeling)
Added Rosetta workflows (folding, docking, design, relax, comparative modeling)
Added MD tools (GROMACS, AMBER, NAMD, OpenMM) and force fields (CHARMM, AMBER, OPLS)
Added homology modeling tools (Modeller, SWISS-MODEL, Phyre2, I-TASSER)
Added comparative modeling and threading approaches
Added physics-based scoring (energy functions, force fields, solvation models)
Added structure refinement methods (gradient minimization, Monte Carlo, MD refinement)
Updated analytical framework with computational workflow hierarchy
Expanded method selection to include MD for dynamics and conformational sampling
Added hybrid workflow guidance combining deep learning and classical methods
Added new few-shot example for homology modeling vs AlphaFold decision-making
Updated constraints to acknowledge template dependence and computational costs
Maintained consolidation within 4000-5000 token budget
